sect1.title: Combat Styles
sect1.para: One of the fundamental premises behind the DNet combat system is that one's fighting style is more important than the actual weapon used. A fighter used to fighting with a broad sword and a shield will find it much easier to fight with a bastard sword and a shield than to fight with a broad sword alone. His combat reflexes are tuned to certain strike sequences relying on the shield to parry blows. For him, fighting without the shield means developping new strike sequences, something that is not always easy to do in the middle of a melee.

formalpara.title: BC
formalpara.para: Base Cost. This is the training cost associated with the skill.

formalpara.title: Talents
formalpara.para: The Talents which forms the basis for using this Skill. (i.e. The Talents acts as a modifier for use of the Skill in the targeting equation.)

formalpara.title: AM
formalpara.para: Attack modifier.

formalpara.title: DM
formalpara.para: Defense modifier.

listitem.para: Close (0 - 1 m; actually engaged in close combat)
Near (1 - 10 m; engaged or able to move to engage this round)
Moderate (11 - 50 m; not in melee range, but probably in missile weapon range)
Far (51 - 100 m; not in melee range, but probably in missile weapon range)
Extreme (> 100 m; out of all but the longest range missile weapons)

formalpara.title: 2nd rank
formalpara.para: Extended weapon reach to attack opponents from a distance, as from behind a line of friendly shield bearers.

formalpara.title: Fend
formalpara.para: Basically Fend keeps opponent with shorter weapon at a distance unable to attack. Opponent who loses against Fend either cannot attack or takes automatic hit at full Damage (maximum for thrusting weapon and STR bonus).

sect1.para: A Fend can be started if an opponent is outside of Close range at the start of a combat round. Otherwise, a successful Fend means that an opponent who is at Close range is unable to attack in the next round. A successful Fend must occur in each subsequent round to keep the opponent at bay.

formalpara.title: Entangle
formalpara.para: Entangle limbs. A successful attack will entangle the limbs of the defender, unless an Agility check against a TD equal to the attacker's total roll is made by the defender. The attacker must specify that he is trying to entangle during the declaration phase.

formalpara.title: Trip
formalpara.para: Entangle legs and trip opponent. A successful attack will entangle the legs of the defender, unless an Agility check against a TD equal to the attacker's total roll is made by the defender. The attacker must specify that he is trying to trip during the declaration phase.

formalpara.title: Shield Bonus
formalpara.para: The use of a shield gives a bonus to defense of 2 plus the shield bonus, which depends on the type of shield.

para.emphasis: Optional: Instead of the fixed +2 defense bonus, the Shield Use skill gives a +1 bonus for every 5 levels, i.e. +1 at levels 1 through 5, +2 at levels 6 through 10, +3 at levels 11 through 15, ...

formalpara.title: Shield Bash
formalpara.para: The ability to use shield as a weapon. Blow causes 2d6 + shield Impact + 1 point per Sise Rating of the attacker + Strength of the attacker. Defender is knocked off his feet and goes prone unless a successful Agility check against a TD equal to the attacker's total roll is made.

formalpara.title: Def Fencing/Close only
formalpara.para: Defense against Fencing and Close styles only.

formalpara.title: Hand
formalpara.para: Attacks with hands or fists do 2d6-8 Impact.

formalpara.title: Foot
formalpara.para: Kicking attacks to 2d6-6 Impact.

formalpara.title: Bash
formalpara.para: Bashing attacks include body slams and tackles. Impact is 2d6-4. A running start is required to do Damage, so no Impact is done if you are already at Close range. (possible to force backwards even if starting at Close range)

formalpara.title: Throw
formalpara.para: Throws include leg sweeps and judo/wrestling throws. IMPACT is 2d6-6 and is not modified by STR. Success leaves the defender prone.

formalpara.title: Hold
formalpara.para: Hold attacks include judo holds and wrestling pins. After a successful attack the defender must make a roll if he wants to try to break the hold.

para.literal: d10-d10* + STR + skill >= holder's STR + skill

sect1.para: The "skill" may be from any style which includes "hold" attacks. If the hold is successful, the attacker may choose to inflict damage:

* Note about HANDS: There are holds and throws which require two hands, and some which require no hands. The GM may judge if a maneuver is possible or more difficult (skill penalty) in some situations, such as if the player has his hands bound.

formalpara.title: Archery
formalpara.para: Any (non-cross) bow. Rate of Fire (ROF) is generally one arrow per round.

formalpara.title: Cross Bows
formalpara.para: All crossbows. ROF will be determined by weapon and Strength. High Strength crossbow weapons may only allow occasional fire 1/3 rounds to 1/10 rounds. If there is a 1/1 rate of fire, damage is minimal e.g. per dagger.

formalpara.title: Thrown Weapons
formalpara.para: Any weapon which can be thrown. Effectiveness is greatly limited with weapons that were not designed to be thrown. Weapons designed to be thrown -- axe, knives, boomerang, darts, javelin, discus, etc. ROF is 1 per round if the weapon is appropriately carried on the body (at girdle or similar -- not in pack). When throwing into a melee situation, ROF is reduced to 1/2 rounds or roll randomly for target.

formalpara.title: Articulated Weapons
formalpara.para: Any articulated weapon. Leveraged weapons (like a flail) are harder to use than a more straightforward weapon. This covers all such weapons, one or two handed, when used without a shield. If a shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Articulated Weapons & Shield
formalpara.para: Any one handed articulated weapon used with a shield. Leveraged weapons (like a flail) are harder to use than a more straightforward weapon. This covers all such one handed weapons, when used with a shield. If no shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the skill.

formalpara.title: Bolas/Whips/Ropes/Nets
formalpara.para: Bolas, whips, ropes and nets.

formalpara.title: Close Weapons
formalpara.para: Weapons such as knives, daggers, brass knuckles, etc. Opponents must be at Close range. If not they can Fend. If a shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Close Weapons & Shield
formalpara.para: Weapons such as knives, daggers, brass knuckles, etc. Opponents must be at Close range. If not they can Fend. If no shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Dual Weapon
formalpara.para: Any 2 weapons which can be wielded with one hand. Comments: minus on defense, or limit defense as in previous post. (i.e. can not defend against weapons more than one `class' larger than secondary weapon without loosing attack. Limit weapons to those smaller than medium with respect to character size/strength.

formalpara.title: Fencing
formalpara.para: Fencing defense can only occur against Fencing and Close Weapons. Against other Styles, reduce Def to 1. Parry repost style fighting with light weight weapons -- edge or point attacks. This is not for unbalanced weapons like axe or mace.

formalpara.title: One-handed Weapons
formalpara.para: Any non-articulated weapon which can be wielded with one hand. If a shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: One-Handed Weapons & Shield
formalpara.para: Any non-articulated weapon which can be wielded with one hand. If no shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Polearms
formalpara.para: Halbards, poles with ax, blade, pick, or exotic ends of reach 2 to 2.5. Pole arms are commonly swung, having blade or pick. They have a higher moment of inertia than Two-Handed Weapons. They also have some closer grip style that allows some parry action with the either end ala quarter staff. Most wielders of pole arms do not like to use that style, prefering to use weapon from 2nd rank. If the weapon has a spear point, it may also be used in Thrusting Weapons Style.

formalpara.title: Staves
formalpara.para: All staves.

formalpara.title: Thrusting Weapons
formalpara.para: Any spear weapon. Includes pike which is a reach 3 spear. This to cover spears and such. Thrusting style does not use nether end for block, but forward shaft. Thrusting Style also includes Fend as an alternative to attack and defend. If a shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Thrusting Weapons & Shield
formalpara.para: Any one-handed spear weapon. Includes pike which is a reach 3 spear. (*pike is one-handed?) This to cover spears and such. This includes shield use for smaller shields. Thrusting weapon may be one handed with shield. Thrusting Style does not use nether end for block, but forward shaft. Thrusting Style also includes Fend as an alternative to attack and defend. If no shield is used, a penalty of -5 is applied to the Skill.

formalpara.title: Two-Handed Weapons
formalpara.para: Any non-articulated weapon which can be wielded with two hands.

sect2.title: Unarmed Styles
sect2.para: I would like to use a minimal list of unarmed combat styles, since it is more in the spirit of the current weapon styles. A well rounded martial artist using this list would learn Karate for the hand and foot maneuvers, Close Weapons for the usual list of Chinese peasant weapons, Judo for the throws, Staff, and One-Handed Weapon skills.

formalpara.title: Boxing
formalpara.para: No defence vs weapons. Hand, brass knuckles. Boxing-ring, or bare-fist style fighting.

formalpara.title: Brawling
formalpara.para: -5 defence vs weapons. Hand, bash. Barroom brawl style.

formalpara.title: Karate
formalpara.para: -3 defence vs weapons. Hand, foot. Generic style for basic Eastern martial arts. We may want to limit weapon defences for Brawling and Karate for small and maybe medium size weapons.

formalpara.title: Judo/Wrestling
formalpara.para: No defence vs weapons. Hold, throw. Generic style for Western-style wrestling and Eastern-style Judo.

sect2.title: Other Combat Skills

formalpara.title: Catch Missiles
formalpara.para: Gives the character a chance to catch missiles, but only if the player says he will try to do so in the declaration phase. The task difficulties (TD) for the various kind of missiles are given below:

formalpara.title: Disarm
formalpara.para: This Skill is used in place of a normal attack to attempt to disarm an opponent. The success check is:

para.literal: d10-d10* + Attakers SA + Attakers STR >= d10-d10* + Defeders SD + Defenders STR

sect2.para: This Skill can be used by both armed and unarmed combatants. Some Combat Styles may have modifiers that are added to your roll when you attempt to disarm an opponent.

para.emphasis: Optional: Both opponents can add the mass of their weapon (rounded to the nearest kilogram) to their roll.

formalpara.title: Dodge
formalpara.para: The Dodge Skill allows the character to attempt to escape blows from two opponents for each Dodge action. It can be used in conjunction with the Style attack/defenses using the multiple actions mechanism.

sect2.para: For example, if a fighter wants to attack one opponent and Dodge two others, the Style actions (attack and defense) and the Dodge action (evading the blows from the two other opponents) will be rolled with a -5 penalty. If the Dodge Skill is used in conjunction with a shield, the bearer can add the shield bonus to his defense roll.
